terms.definition: Step-by-step instructional documents that help users understand how to use a product or service effectively.
A system that allows customers to find answers and solve problems independently without contacting support staff.
A software system that provides tools for creating, organizing, storing, and publishing technical documentation.
A centralized web-based platform where users can access organized information, documentation, and resources.
A system for tracking and managing different versions of documents, allowing users to access current and historical content.
Hyperlinks that connect one page or section of documentation to another within the same knowledge base or website.
An organized list of topics and sections in a document that allows readers to quickly navigate to specific information.
A software development methodology that emphasizes iterative development, collaboration, and rapid response to change.
Pre-designed document structures that provide consistent formatting and organization for creating new content.
The process of inserting multimedia content like videos, images, or interactive elements directly into documentation.
An HTML element that allows embedding external web content within a webpage or document.
A centralized repository of information and documentation that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
Application Programming Interface - a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate with each other.
A programming language commonly used for creating interactive web content and applications.
A record of changes made to a document over time, allowing users to track modifications and revert to previous versions.
